movie.title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
movie.plot_summary: Harry Potter's second year at Hogwarts is marred by mysterious petrifications and a chilling message: 'The Chamber of Secrets was opened.' With his friends Ron and Hermione, Harry investigates, brewing Polyjuice Potion to question suspects and delving into the legend of Salazar Slytherin. Harry discovers he can speak Parseltongue, leading to suspicion that he is Slytherin's heir. He uncovers the truth through Tom Riddle's diary, revealing Riddle framed Hagrid 50 years prior. As the school faces potential closure and Ginny Weasley is abducted, Harry confronts the spectral Tom Riddle, who reveals his identity as Lord Voldemort, in the Chamber of Secrets. Harry slays the Basilisk with the Sword of Gryffindor and destroys Riddle's diary with a basilisk fang, saving Ginny and vanquishing Voldemort's memory. The school is restored, petrified victims are healed, Hagrid returns, and Harry ingeniously frees the house-elf Dobby.
movie.mood: Mysterious, Tense, Adventurous, Dark, Triumphant, Hopeful

characters.name: Harry Potter
characters.description: A young wizard confined by his abusive guardians, warned of danger, dramatically rescued, and later becomes the central figure in investigating and defeating the Chamber of Secrets threat. He discovers his Parseltongue ability and battles Tom Riddle.

characters.name: Dobby
characters.description: A self-punishing house-elf who tries to warn Harry of danger, intercepts his mail, and orchestrates events (like the Quidditch incident) to force Harry from Hogwarts, believing it's for his protection. Later freed by Harry.

characters.name: The Dursleys
characters.description: Harry's abusive Muggle guardians who confine him and whose important dinner is ruined by Dobby's magic.

characters.name: Ron Weasley
characters.description: Harry's best friend who helps rescue him from the Dursleys, flies him to Hogwarts, and assists in the investigation of the Chamber of Secrets. Attempts to hex Draco Malfoy.

characters.name: Fred Weasley
characters.description: One of Ron's older twin brothers who helps rescue Harry in a flying car.

characters.name: George Weasley
characters.description: One of Ron's older twin brothers who helps rescue Harry in a flying car.

characters.name: Lucius Malfoy
characters.archetype: The Villain's Minion / The Corrupt Official
characters.description: Draco's father, encountered in Knockturn Alley, later tricked by Harry into freeing Dobby.

characters.name: Gilderoy Lockhart
characters.description: The self-aggrandizing new Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher, exposed as a fraud, who attempts a memory charm but instead erases his own memory.

characters.name: Professor Snape
characters.description: A Potions Master who incurs the ire of Harry and Ron for their unauthorized flight to Hogwarts and gives them detention.

characters.name: Professor Sprout
characters.description: The Herbology professor, who teaches bizarre lessons.

characters.name: Draco Malfoy
characters.description: Harry's rival, who insults Hermione and is suspected by the trio of being Salazar Slytherin's heir.

characters.name: Hermione Granger
characters.description: Harry's best friend, insulted by Malfoy, instrumental in researching the Chamber of Secrets legend and discovering the monster's identity. Accidentally transforms into a cat with Polyjuice Potion. Later petrified and healed.

characters.name: Argus Filch
characters.description: Hogwarts caretaker whose cat, Mrs. Norris, is the first victim of petrification.

characters.name: Mrs. Norris
characters.description: Filch's cat, mysteriously petrified by the monster from the Chamber of Secrets.

characters.name: Salazar Slytherin
characters.description: One of Hogwarts' founders, builder of the Chamber of Secrets, whose heir is destined to 'cleanse' the school of Muggle-borns.

characters.name: Justin Finch-Fletchley
characters.description: A Hufflepuff student who is attacked and petrified.

characters.name: Tom Marvolo Riddle (Lord Voldemort)
characters.description: Owner of a mysterious diary, a younger version of Lord Voldemort, who framed Hagrid 50 years prior and manipulated Ginny Weasley to reopen the Chamber of Secrets.

characters.name: Rubeus Hagrid
characters.archetype: The Gentle Giant / The Falsely Accused
characters.description: Gamekeeper at Hogwarts, framed for opening the Chamber of Secrets 50 years ago, later re-arrested, and advises Harry to 'follow the spiders'.

characters.name: Albus Dumbledore
characters.description: Hogwarts Headmaster, suspended by the school governors, later explains Harry's connection to Voldemort's powers.

characters.name: Aragog
characters.description: Hagrid's pet giant spider, who denies being the monster but warns Harry and Ron of an ancient creature in the castle.

characters.name: Ginny Weasley
characters.description: Ron's younger sister, abducted into the Chamber of Secrets, manipulated by Tom Riddle through his diary, and saved by Harry.

characters.name: Moaning Myrtle
characters.description: A ghost who inhabits a bathroom at Hogwarts, her testimony about her death 50 years ago is crucial to finding the Chamber of Secrets.

scenes.summary: Harry Potter is confined by the Dursleys and receives a warning from Dobby, a house-elf, about a dangerous conspiracy at Hogwarts, with Dobby having intercepted Harry's mail.
Dobby's magic ruins the Dursleys' important dinner, leading to Harry's dramatic rescue by Ron, Fred, and George Weasley in a flying car.
Harry is welcomed into the warm, chaotic home of the Weasleys.
Harry and the Weasleys travel to Diagon Alley, where Harry accidentally lands in Knockturn Alley, encounters Lucius Malfoy, and later meets the self-aggrandizing Gilderoy Lockhart.
Harry and Ron are unable to access Platform 9 3/4 as the magical barrier inexplicably closes, preventing them from boarding the Hogwarts Express.
Harry and Ron fly a magical car to Hogwarts, nearly crashing, incurring Professor Snape's ire, and being given detention.
At school, they endure bizarre Herbology lessons with Professor Sprout and meet the vain Professor Lockhart.
Draco Malfoy insults Hermione by calling her a 'mudblood,' prompting Ron to attempt a hex that comically backfires.

Harry begins hearing a chilling, disembodied voice warning of killing, leading him, Ron, and Hermione to discover Filch's cat, Mrs. Norris, mysteriously petrified. A bloody message on the wall declares, 'The Chamber of Secrets was opened. Enemies of the heir, be careful.' Harry is immediately suspected.
key_quotes: The Chamber of Secrets was opened. Enemies of the heir, be careful.

scenes.summary: Harry, Ron, and Hermione delve into the ancient legend of the Chamber of Secrets, learning it was built by Salazar Slytherin's heir to 'cleanse' the school of Muggle-borns, and resolve to brew Polyjuice Potion to interrogate Draco Malfoy.
A dangerous Quidditch incident is orchestrated by Dobby, a house-elf trying to force Harry from Hogwarts due to impending peril.
At a dueling club, Harry unwittingly reveals his ability to speak Parseltongue to a snake, causing alarm and suspicion among his peers who now wonder if he is Slytherin's heir.
Harry, Ron, and Hermione decide to use Polyjuice Potion to question Draco Malfoy for information, though Hermione accidentally transforms into a cat.
Harry finds a mysterious diary belonging to Tom Marvolo Riddle, which transports him back 50 years to witness past events.
Harry discovers that a young Tom Riddle framed Hagrid for opening the Chamber of Secrets and causing a student's death, leading to Hagrid's expulsion.
Hogwarts is gripped by fear as students are petrified, leading to the school's potential closure and the arrest of Hagrid; Dumbledore is also suspended by the school governors.

Before being taken away, Hagrid cryptically advises Harry and Ron to 'follow the spiders,' leading them into the Forbidden Forest where his pet, Aragog, denies being the monster but warns of an ancient, feared creature within the castle.
Hermione's crucial discovery, based on her research, reveals the monster to be a Basilisk, whose lethal gaze explains the petrified victims as they saw it indirectly.

Ginny Weasley is abducted into the Chamber, while the incompetent Professor Lockhart, exposed as a fraud, attempts to erase Harry and Ron's memories before they can use Moaning Myrtle's testimony about her death 50 years ago to find her.
Harry and Ron confront the fraudulent Gilderoy Lockhart, who attempts to use a memory charm but instead erases his own memory.
Following Myrtle's guidance, Harry enters the Chamber of Secrets, finding an unconscious Ginny and the spectral Tom Riddle.
Tom Riddle reveals he is Lord Voldemort and manipulated Ginny through his diary.
Harry battles and slays the Basilisk with the Sword of Gryffindor.
Harry destroys Tom Riddle's diary with a basilisk fang, saving Ginny and vanquishing Voldemort's memory.
Dumbledore explains Harry's connection to Voldemort's powers but emphasizes his choices define him, while Harry cleverly tricks Lucius Malfoy into freeing his house-elf, Dobby.
The school celebrates as all petrified victims, including Hermione, are healed and Hagrid returns from Azkaban.

events.name: Dobby's Warning
events.description: Dobby warns Harry Potter about a dangerous conspiracy at Hogwarts and has intercepted his mail.
events.significance: Foreshadows danger, initiates Dobby's interference.

events.name: Harry's Rescue by Weasleys
events.description: After Dobby's magic ruins the Dursleys' dinner, Harry is rescued by Ron, Fred, and George Weasley in a flying car.
events.significance: Removes Harry from abusive environment, introduces him to the Weasley family.

events.name: Knockturn Alley Encounter
events.description: Harry accidentally lands in Knockturn Alley, where he encounters Lucius Malfoy.
events.significance: Introduces Lucius Malfoy as a dark figure.

events.name: Meeting Gilderoy Lockhart
events.description: Harry meets the self-aggrandizing Gilderoy Lockhart in Diagon Alley.
events.significance: Introduces a key, albeit incompetent, character.

events.name: Platform 9 3/4 Barrier Closure
events.description: Harry and Ron are unable to access Platform 9 3/4, preventing them from boarding the Hogwarts Express.
events.significance: Sets up their unauthorized flight to Hogwarts, later revealed to be Dobby's doing.

events.name: Flight to Hogwarts
events.description: Harry and Ron fly a magical car to Hogwarts, nearly crashing and incurring Professor Snape's ire.
events.significance: Leads to detention, highlights their rebellious nature, and Dobby's continued interference.

events.name: Malfoy's 'Mudblood' Insult
events.description: Draco Malfoy insults Hermione by calling her a 'mudblood,' a derogatory term for Muggle-borns.
events.significance: Highlights prejudice against Muggle-borns, introduces a key term related to the Chamber of Secrets mystery.

events.name: First Petrification and Message
events.description: Filch's cat, Mrs. Norris, is found mysteriously petrified alongside a bloody message on the wall: 'The Chamber of Secrets was opened. Enemies of the heir, be careful.'
events.significance: Marks the opening of the Chamber of Secrets, initiates the central mystery.

events.name: Harry Suspected
events.description: Harry is immediately suspected of the attack on Mrs. Norris.
events.significance: Creates tension and personal peril for Harry.

events.name: Investigation of Chamber Legend
events.description: Harry, Ron, and Hermione delve into the ancient legend of the Chamber of Secrets, learning it was built by Salazar Slytherin's heir to 'cleanse' the school.
events.significance: Provides crucial background and motivates their plan to investigate.

events.name: Polyjuice Potion Plan
events.description: The trio resolves to brew Polyjuice Potion to interrogate Draco Malfoy, whom they suspect.
events.significance: Sets up a key investigative subplot.

events.name: Quidditch Incident
events.description: Dobby orchestrates a dangerous Quidditch incident in an attempt to force Harry from Hogwarts due to impending peril.
events.significance: Another attempt by Dobby to protect Harry, increases stakes.

events.name: Parseltongue Revelation
events.description: At a dueling club, Harry unwittingly reveals his ability to speak Parseltongue to a snake.
events.significance: Causes alarm and suspicion, linking Harry directly to Salazar Slytherin and the Heir.

events.name: Hermione's Polyjuice Potion Accident
events.description: Harry, Ron, and Hermione use Polyjuice Potion, but Hermione accidentally transforms into a cat.
events.significance: Adds a humorous setback to their investigation.

events.name: Tom Riddle's Diary Discovery
events.description: Harry finds a mysterious diary belonging to Tom Marvolo Riddle.
events.significance: Major plot device, transports Harry into the past, crucial to solving the mystery.

events.name: Hagrid Framed
events.description: Harry witnesses a young Tom Riddle framing Hagrid for opening the Chamber of Secrets 50 years ago, leading to Hagrid's expulsion.
events.significance: Clears Hagrid's name, reveals Riddle's manipulative nature, deepens the Chamber's mystery.

events.name: School Closure Threat & Arrests
events.description: Hogwarts is gripped by fear as students are petrified, leading to the school's potential closure and the arrest of Hagrid; Dumbledore is also suspended.
events.significance: Raises stakes dramatically, removes key protective figures.

events.name: Hagrid's 'Follow the Spiders' Advice
events.description: Before being taken away, Hagrid cryptically advises Harry and Ron to 'follow the spiders.'
events.significance: Leads Harry and Ron into the Forbidden Forest to find Aragog.

events.name: Aragog Encounter
events.description: Harry and Ron enter the Forbidden Forest and meet Aragog, who denies being the monster but warns of an ancient creature.
events.significance: Provides more clues about the true monster without revealing its identity directly.

events.name: Basilisk Discovery
events.description: Hermione's crucial discovery reveals the monster to be a Basilisk, explaining the petrified victims.
events.significance: Identifies the true threat, provides a means to understand the attacks.

events.name: Ginny's Abduction
events.description: Ginny Weasley is abducted into the Chamber of Secrets.
events.significance: Elevates the urgency and personal stakes of the mission.

events.name: Lockhart's Exposure & Memory Charm Attempt
events.description: Professor Lockhart is exposed as a fraud and attempts to erase Harry and Ron's memories before they can use Moaning Myrtle's testimony.
events.significance: Removes a hindrance and leads to his self-incapacitation.

events.name: Lockhart Erases Own Memory
events.description: Gilderoy Lockhart's memory charm backfires, erasing his own memory.
events.significance: Effectively removes him as a character and source of frustration.

events.name: Entry into Chamber of Secrets
events.description: Following Myrtle's guidance, Harry enters the Chamber of Secrets.
events.significance: Initiates the final confrontation.

events.name: Riddle's Revelation (Voldemort)
events.description: The spectral Tom Riddle reveals he is Lord Voldemort and manipulated Ginny through his diary.
events.significance: Confirms the primary antagonist's identity and method of attack.

events.name: Basilisk Battle
events.description: Harry battles and slays the Basilisk with the Sword of Gryffindor.
events.significance: Defeats the monster terrorizing Hogwarts.

events.name: Diary Destruction
events.description: Harry destroys Tom Riddle's diary with a basilisk fang.
events.significance: Vanquishes Voldemort's memory/Horcrux and closes the Chamber of Secrets.

events.name: Ginny's Rescue
events.description: Harry saves Ginny Weasley after defeating Tom Riddle and the Basilisk.
events.significance: Achieves the primary goal of the climax.

events.name: Dumbledore's Explanation
events.description: Dumbledore explains Harry's connection to Voldemort's powers but emphasizes his choices define him.
events.significance: Provides thematic closure and guidance for Harry's character arc.

events.name: Dobby's Freedom
events.description: Harry cleverly tricks Lucius Malfoy into freeing his house-elf, Dobby.
events.significance: Resolves Dobby's subplot, shows Harry's cleverness and compassion.

events.name: School Restored & Victims Healed
events.description: All petrified victims, including Hermione, are healed, and Hagrid returns from Azkaban. The school celebrates.
events.significance: Restores normalcy and concludes the film on a positive note.

locations.name: Dursleys' Home
locations.description: The abusive home where Harry Potter is confined at the beginning of the film.

locations.name: The Burrow (Weasleys' Home)
locations.description: The warm, chaotic home of the Weasley family where Harry is welcomed.

locations.name: Diagon Alley
locations.description: A bustling magical shopping street where wizards and witches purchase supplies.

locations.name: Knockturn Alley
locations.description: A dark, seedy alley off Diagon Alley, frequented by practitioners of dark magic.

locations.name: Platform 9 3/4
locations.description: The magical platform at King's Cross Station from which the Hogwarts Express departs.

locations.name: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry
locations.description: The main setting for the film, a castle and school for young witches and wizards.

locations.name: Dueling Club (Hogwarts)
locations.description: A temporary club at Hogwarts where students practice dueling spells.

locations.name: Forbidden Forest
locations.description: A dangerous forest on the borders of Hogwarts grounds, home to various magical creatures, including Aragog and his colony.

locations.name: Chamber of Secrets
locations.description: A hidden chamber beneath Hogwarts, built by Salazar Slytherin, which houses the Basilisk and is reopened by Tom Riddle.

locations.name: Moaning Myrtle's Bathroom
locations.description: A girls' bathroom at Hogwarts haunted by the ghost of Moaning Myrtle, also the entrance to the Chamber of Secrets.

locations.name: Dumbledore's Office
locations.description: The office of the Headmaster of Hogwarts, a place of wisdom and magical artifacts.

objects.name: Flying Car (Ford Anglia)
objects.significance: Used by the Weasleys to rescue Harry and later by Harry and Ron to fly to Hogwarts.

objects.name: Harry's Mail
objects.significance: Intercepted by Dobby to prevent Harry's return to Hogwarts, highlighting Dobby's interference.

objects.name: Bloody Message on Wall
objects.significance: Declares 'The Chamber of Secrets was opened. Enemies of the heir, be careful.' Central to the mystery.

objects.name: Polyjuice Potion
objects.significance: A magical potion that allows the drinker to temporarily assume the form of another person, used for investigation.

objects.name: Tom Marvolo Riddle's Diary
objects.significance: A mysterious diary that transports Harry into past events and contains a fragment of Lord Voldemort's soul, used to manipulate Ginny.

objects.name: Basilisk
objects.significance: The ancient, feared creature residing in the Chamber of Secrets, whose lethal gaze petrifies victims.

objects.name: Sword of Gryffindor
objects.significance: A goblin-made sword that appears to Harry in the Chamber of Secrets, used to slay the Basilisk.

objects.name: Basilisk Fang
objects.significance: Used by Harry to destroy Tom Riddle's diary due to its poisonous properties.

relationships.description: Rescued by and friends with Ron.
Clears name of and advised by Hagrid.
Warns and tries to protect Harry.
Owned by and freed from Lucius Malfoy.
Testified about death in location where Ginny was taken.
Leads to use of flying car.
Flying car is used in the event.
The message appears as part of the event.
Polyjuice Potion is central to the plan.
Basilisk is identified as the monster.
Lockhart is exposed and attempts the charm.
Lockhart is the subject of the event.
Sword is used in the battle.
Basilisk fang is used for destruction.
